attributes.additional_details:
BBC News draws attention to a survey in which out of 1,903 13-21 year olds in the UK, two thirds felt unsafe or knew someone fearful of walking home alone.

In 2016 a poll was taken on street harassment showing 64% of women of all ages experienced unwanted sexual harassment and 35% had experiences unwanted sexual touching. - source youGov.

The Guardian - Figures show that women are five times more likely than men to have experienced a type of sexual assult, unwanted touching or indecent exposure.
attributes.background: So many women in this day and age fear walking alone anywhere night or day. The only defence legalised in the UK at the moment is a rape alarm, whilst it may deter an attacker we can not assume it will every time.
